post.summary: Clear the alert for a given resource
Get a list of alerts from the storage cluster
Erases an alert for a given resource
Enumerate lists all the nodes in the cluster.
Inspect the node given a UUID.

Create credential for AWS S3 and if valid ,
returns a unique identifier

Create credential for Azure and if valid ,
returns a unique identifier

Create credential for Google and if valid ,
returns a unique identifier
Delete a specified credential
EnumerateForAWS lists the configured AWS credentials
EnumerateForAzure lists the configured Azure credentials
EnumerateForGoogle lists the configured Google credentials
Validate a specified credential
Attach device to host
Creates a new volume
CreateFromVolumeID creates a new volume cloned from an existing volume
Delete a volume
Detaches the volume from the node.
Get a list of volumes
Get information on a volume
Attaches the volume to a node.

Create a snapshot of a volume. This creates an immutable (read-only),
point-in-time snapshot of a volume.
List the number of snapshots for a specific volume
Restores a volume to a specified snapshot
Unmount volume at specified path

ttl.title: TTL in seconds for this Alert

unique_tag.title: UniqueTag helps identify a unique alert for a given resouce

apiAlert.title:
Alert is a structure that represents an alert object
swagger:model

apiAlerts.title:
Alerts is an array of Alert objects
swagger:model

apiAttachState.title:
- ATTACH_STATE_EXTERNAL: Attached and available externally
 - ATTACH_STATE_INTERNAL: Attached but only available internally
 - ATTACH_STATE_INTERNAL_SWITCH: Switching from External to Internal

alert_id.title: Id of alert as returned by ClusterEnumerateAlertResponse (required)
Id of alert as returned by ClusterEnumerateAlertResponse (required)

id.description: Id common identifier across volumes that have the same group.

apiGroup.title:
Group represents VolumeGroup / namespace
All volumes in the same group share this object.
swagger:model

name.description: Unique name of the volume. This will be used for idempotency.

apiReplicaSet.title:
ReplicaSet set of machine IDs (nodes) to which part of this volume is erasure
coded - for clustered storage arrays
swagger:model

apiRuntimeStateMap.title:
RuntimeStateMap is a list of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.
swagger:model

parent.description: A volume id, if specified will create a clone of the parent.

seed.title:
Seed will seed the volume from the specified URI
Any additional config for the source comes from the labels in the spec

apiSource.title:
Source is a structure that can be given to a volume
to seed the volume with data.
swagger:model

apiStatus.title: - STATUS_MAX: Add statuses before MAX and update the number for MAX

node_id.title: NodeId is the id of the node servicing these requests

nodes.title: Nodes are a list of all the nodes on the cluster

apiStorageCluster.title: StorageCluster represents the state of the cluster

apiStorageMedium.title:
- STORAGE_MEDIUM_MAGNETIC: Magnetic spinning disk.
 - STORAGE_MEDIUM_SSD: SSD disk
 - STORAGE_MEDIUM_NVME: NVME disk

disks.title: List of disks on the node

pools.title: List of storage pools this node supports

node_labels.title: User defined labels for the node

apiStorageNode.title: StorageNode describes the state of the node

Cos.title: Cos reflects the capabilities of this drive pool

labels.title: Labels is a list of user defined name-value pairs

apiStoragePool.title: StoragePool groups different storage devices based on their CosType

path.description: Path device path for this storage resource.

online.description: True if this device is online.

rotation_speed.description: True if this device is rotational.

last_scan.description: Timestamp of last time this device was scanned.

apiStorageResource.title:
StorageResource groups properties of a storage device.
swagger:model

source.description: Source specified seed data for the volume.

group.description: Group volumes in the same group have the same group id.

readonly.description: Readonly is true if this volume is to be mounted with readonly access.

usage.description: Usage is bytes consumed by vtheis volume.

last_scan.description: LastScan is the time when an integrity check was run.

format.description: Format specifies the filesytem for this volume.

status.description: Status is the availability status of this volume.

state.description: State is the current runtime state of this volume.

attached_on.description: AttachedOn is the node instance identifier for clustered systems.

attached_state.description: AttachedState shows whether the device is attached for internal or external use.

device_path.description: DevicePath is the device exported by block device implementations.

secure_device_path.description: SecureDevicePath is the device path for an encrypted volume.

attach_path.description: AttachPath is the mounted path in the host namespace.

attach_info.description: AttachInfo is a list of name value mappings that provides attach information.

replica_sets.description: ReplicatSets storage for this volumefor clustered storage arrays.

runtime_state.description:
RuntimeState is a lst of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

error.description: Error is the Last recorded error.

volume_consumers.title: VolumeConsumers are entities that consume this volume

apiVolume.title:
Volume represents an abstract storage volume.
Volume represents an abstract storage volume.
swagger:model

options.title: Options for attaching volume, right now only passphrase options is supported

device_path.title: Device path where device is exported

name.title: Name is the name of the volume consumer

namespace.title: Namespace is the namespace of the volume consumer

type.title: Type is the type of the consumer. E.g a Kubernetes pod

node_id.description:
NodeID is the identifier of the node on which the consumer is running. This
identifier would be from the perspective of the container runtime or
orchestrator under which the volume consumer resides. For example, NodeID
 can be name of a minion in Kubernetes.

owner_name.title: OwnerName is the name of the entity who owns this volume consumer

owner_type.description:
OwnerType is the type of the entity who owns this volume consumer. The type would
be from the perspective of the container runtime or the orchestrator under which
the volume consumer resides. For e.g OwnerType can be a Deployment in Kubernetes.

apiVolumeConsumer.title:
VolumeConsumer identifies a consumer for a Volume. An example of a VolumeConsumer
would be a Pod in Kubernetes who has mounted the PersistentVolumeClaim for the
Volume
swagger: model

name.description: Unique name of the volume. This will be used for idempotency.

parent_id.description: Parent volume id, if specified will create a new volume as a clone of the parent.

locator.description:
Volumes to match to this locator.
If not provided, all volumes will be returned.

volume_labels.title: A set of name-value pairs that acts as search filters

apiVolumeLocator.title:
VolumeLocator is a structure that is attached to a volume
and is used to carry opaque metadata.
swagger:model

mount_path.description: Mount path for mounting the volume.

volume_id.title: Id of volume to take the snapshot from

size.description: Size specifies the thin provisioned volume size.

format.description: Format specifies the filesystem for this volume.

ha_level.description: HaLevel specifies the number of copies of data.

cos.description: Cos specifies the relative class of service.

io_profile.description: IoProfile provides a hint about application using this volume.

dedupe.description: Dedupe specifies if the volume data is to be de-duplicated.

snapshot_interval.title: SnapshotInterval in minutes, set to 0 to disable snapshots

shared.description: Shared is true if this volume can be remotely accessed.

replica_set.description: ReplicaSet is the desired set of nodes for the volume data.

aggregation_level.description: Aggregatiokn level Specifies the number of parts the volume can be aggregated from.

encrypted.description: Encrypted is true if this volume will be cryptographically secured.

snapshot_schedule.description: SnapshotSchedule a well known string that specifies when snapshots should be taken.

sticky.description: Sticky volumes cannot be deleted until the flag is removed.

group_enforced.description: GroupEnforced is true if consistency group creation is enforced.

compressed.description: Compressed is true if this volume is to be compressed.

cascaded.description: Cascaded is true if this volume can be populated on any node from an external source.

journal.description: Journal is true if data for the volume goes into the journal.

sharedv4.description: Sharedv4 is true if this volume can be accessed via sharedv4.

apiVolumeSpec.title:
VolumeSpec has the properties needed to create a volume.
swagger:model

apiVolumeState.description:
VolumeState represents the state of a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATE_PENDING: Volume is transitioning to new state
 - VOLUME_STATE_AVAILABLE: Volume is ready to be assigned to a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_ATTACHED: Volume is attached to container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETACHED: Volume is detached but associated with a container
 - VOLUME_STATE_DETATCHING: Volume detach is in progress
 - VOLUME_STATE_ERROR: Volume is in error state
 - VOLUME_STATE_DELETED: Volume is deleted, it will remain in this state
while resources are asynchronously reclaimed
 - VOLUME_STATE_TRY_DETACHING: Volume is trying to be detached
 - VOLUME_STATE_RESTORE: Volume is undergoing restore

apiVolumeStatus.description:
VolumeStatus represents a health status for a volume.

 - VOLUME_STATUS_NOT_PRESENT: Volume is not present
 - VOLUME_STATUS_UP: Volume is healthy
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DOWN: Volume is in fail mode
 - VOLUME_STATUS_DEGRADED: Volume is up but with degraded performance
In a RAID group, this may indicate a problem with one or more drives
